line_1: And who'd be quite polite must be a rogue,
line_2: Next, because bus'ness now is all the vogue,

line_1: You have two servants — Tom, an arch, sly rogue,
line_2: From top to toe the Geta now in vogue;

line_1: With you in the thirtieth! you impudent rogue!
line_2: Can such wretches as you give to madness a vogue!

line_1: The envied liberty to be a rogue;
line_2: Such is the blessed liberty in vogue,

line_1: On either side is, honest man, or rogue.
line_2: There is no medium; for the term in vogue,

line_1: If one man call'd another rogue,
line_2: And though it was a rule in vogue,
